entry.title: Google/ Alphabet å°‡æˆæ–°ä¸€ä»£ç¾è‚¡è‚¡ç‹!
entry.content:
Published on: 2025-11-17T22:57:24+0800


  • Product innovation was underscored across Search, Cloud, YouTube, and Waymo, with momentum in AI Overviews and AI Mode, stating, â€œAI Overviews drive meaningful query growth. This effect was even stronger in Q3 as users continue to learn that Google can answer more of their questions.â€
  • Philipp Schindler, SVP & Chief Business Officer of Google, shared, â€œGoogle Services revenues were $87 billion for the quarter, up 14% year-on-year driven by accelerated growth in Search and YouTube.â€ He highlighted AI Max in Search as â€œthe fastest-growing AI-powered search ads product,â€ and noted, â€œIn Q3 alone, AI Max unlocked billions of net new queries.â€
  • Anat Ashkenazi, Senior VP & CFO, stated, â€œWe had an outstanding quarter in Q3, continuing the strong momentum we've had throughout the year, delivering double-digit revenue growth across Search and YouTube advertising, subscriptions, platforms and devices, and Google Cloud. Consolidated revenue reached $102.3 billion, a 16% year-over-year increase.â€
Outlook
  • Ashkenazi indicated, â€œAt the current spot rates, we could see an FX tailwind to our revenues in Q4. However, the volatility in exchange rates could affect the impact of FX on Q4 revenues.â€
  • For CapEx, she stated, â€œWe now expect CapEx to be in the range of $91 billion to $93 billion in 2025, up from our previous estimate of $85 billion... Looking out to 2026, we expect a significant increase in CapEx, and we'll provide more detail on our fourth quarter earnings call.â€
  • She added, â€œIn Cloud, demand for our products remains high as evidenced by the accelerating revenue growth and the $49 billion sequential increase in Cloud backlog in Q3.â€
Financial Results
  • Consolidated revenue was reported at $102.3 billion, a 16% year-over-year increase.
  • Total cost of revenue was $41.4 billion, and operating income increased 9% to $31.2 billion. Operating margin was 30.5%.
  • Net income increased 33% to $35 billion, and earnings per share increased 35% to $2.87.
  • Free cash flow for the quarter was $24.5 billion.
  • Google Cloud revenue increased by 34% to $15.2 billion, and Cloud operating income increased by 85% to $3.6 billion. Google Cloud's backlog surged to $155 billion.
  • Google Services revenues reached $87.1 billion, and operating income increased 9% to $33.5 billion, with an operating margin of 38.5%.
Q&A
  • Brian Nowak, Morgan Stanley: Asked about agentic e-commerce and integration of Waymo with Gemini. Philipp Schindler replied that agentic experiences are â€œreally as additive to the way people seek information,â€ describing efforts to integrate agentic shopping and partnerships with PayPal. Sundar Pichai said, â€œWaymo clearly is scaling up, particularly in 2026. I think the possibility... of Gemini... with the multimodal experience as well as services like YouTube, I think there's a real opportunity to make the in-car experience dramatically better.â€
  • Douglas Anmuth, JPMorgan: Asked about drivers of core search strength and cost base opportunities. Schindler noted, â€œAI Overviews is scaling up and working for our entire user base. We're now scaled to over 2 billion users here... we see the monetization at approximately the same rate.â€ Ashkenazi described ongoing efforts to drive productivity and efficiency, including moderating headcount growth and leveraging AI for internal productivity.
  • Eric Sheridan, Goldman Sachs: Asked about custom silicon and YouTube monetization. Pichai explained, â€œWe are seeing substantial demand for our AI infrastructure products, including TPU-based and GPU-based solutions... we continue to see very strong demand, and we are investing to meet that.â€ Schindler discussed YouTubeâ€™s â€œtwin engine monetization strategy, combining its advertising business and its growing subscription services.â€
  • Mark Shmulik, Bernstein: Inquired about Gemini and AI Mode engagement differences. Pichai responded, â€œAI Overviews are a natural part of the Google experience, and so engagement is very, very high. I would say AI Mode... thereâ€™s a core group, which really likes AI Mode and is passionate about it.â€
  • Michael Nathanson, MoffettNathanson: Asked about query length in AI Mode and ROIC. Schindler said, â€œIt's really too early to tell and go into any of the details of that testing.â€ Ashkenazi highlighted a â€œrigorous framework and approach by which we evaluate these long-term investments.â€
Sentiment Analysis
  • Analyst sentiment was generally focused and constructive, with pointed questions on agentic commerce, AI monetization, and cost discipline, but without overt skepticism.
  • Management maintained a confident tone throughout, emphasizing strong metrics, innovation, and disciplined investment. Pichai and Ashkenazi consistently used language such as â€œstrong momentum,â€ â€œexcited,â€ and â€œopportunity ahead.â€
  • Compared to the previous quarter, managementâ€™s tone remained upbeat, with additional emphasis on scaling infrastructure and investments. Analyst tone stayed focused on monetization and strategic execution, mirroring previous quartersâ€™ themes.
